metadata.Title: CVE-2018-6126 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - medium
metadata.Description:
A precision error in Skia in Google Chrome prior to 67.0.3396.62 allowed aremote attacker to perform an out of bounds memory write via a crafted HTMLpage.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-6126` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

chromium-browser - 67.0.3396.99-0ubuntu0.16.04.2
chromium-browser-l10n - 67.0.3396.99-0ubuntu0.16.04.2
chromium-chromedriver - 67.0.3396.99-0ubuntu0.16.04.2
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg - 67.0.3396.99-0ubuntu0.16.04.2
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg-extra - 67.0.3396.99-0ubuntu0.16.04.2
No subscription required

firefox - 60.0.2+build1-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
firefox-globalmenu - 60.0.2+build1-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
firefox-mozsymbols - 60.0.2+build1-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
firefox-testsuite - 60.0.2+build1-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
No subscription required

thunderbird - 1:60.2.1+build1-0ubuntu0.16.04.4
thunderbird-globalmenu - 1:60.2.1+build1-0ubuntu0.16.04.4
thunderbird-gnome-support - 1:60.2.1+build1-0ubuntu0.16.04.4
thunderbird-mozsymbols - 1:60.2.1+build1-0ubuntu0.16.04.4
thunderbird-testsuite - 1:60.2.1+build1-0ubuntu0.16.04.4
xul-ext-calendar-timezones - 1:60.2.1+build1-0ubuntu0.16.04.4
xul-ext-gdata-provider - 1:60.2.1+build1-0ubuntu0.16.04.4
xul-ext-lightning - 1:60.2.1+build1-0ubuntu0.16.04.4
No subscription required

criterions.comment: chromium-browser package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '67.0.3396.99-0ubuntu0.16.04.2').
oxide-qt: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
firefox package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '60.0.2+build1-0ubuntu0.16.04.1').
thunderbird package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:60.2.1+build1-0ubuntu0.16.04.4').
